intro: Racosperma mutabile, commonly known as the variable acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring bipinnate leaves and yellow flowers arranged in dense spikes. Its adaptability to various soil types and drought conditions makes it a resilient species in its native habitat. Racosperma mutabile is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
